## This is a heading ### This is a subheading ### This is a sub-subheading This is a paragraph. You can add emphasis to text by using _asterisks_ or _underscores_. For example, _this text will be italicized_ and _this text will be italicized_. You can also make text **bold** by using **double asterisks** or **double underscore**. For example, **this text will be bold** and **this text will be bold**. You can create lists by using hyphen (-) or asterisks (\*). For example: - Item 1 - Item 2 - Item 3 Or: - Item 1 - Item 2 - Item 3 You can also create ordered lists by using numbers. For example: 1. First item 2. Second item 3. Third item You can add links by using bracket [] and parentheses (). For example: [Google](https://www.google/com) will create a link to Google. You can add images by using an exclamation mark (!), brackets [], and parentheses (). For example: ![Minion](https://octodex.github.com/images/minion.png) "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Ut enim ad minim veniam, quis nostrud exercitation ullamco laboris nisi ut aliquip ex ea commodo consequat. Duis aute irure dolor in reprehenderit in voluptate velit esse cillum dolore eu fugiat nulla pariatur. Excepteur sint occaecat cupidatat non proident, sunt in culpa qui officia deserunt mollit anim id est laborum." line break with '   ' line break with `
`
--- ## Emphasis **This is bold text** _This is italic text_ ~~Strikethrough~~ ## Blockquotes > Blockquotes can also be nested... > > > ...by using additional greater-than signs right next to each other... > > > > > ...or with spaces between arrows. ## Lists Unordered - Create a list by starting a line with `-` or `*` - Sub-lists are made by indenting 2 spaces: - Marker character change forces new list start: - Ac tristique libero volutpat at * Facilisis in pretium nisl aliquet - Very easy! Ordered 1. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet 2. Consectetur adipiscing elit 3. Integer molestie lorem at massa 4. You can use sequential numbers... 5. ...or keep all the numbers as `1.` Start numbering with offset: 57. foo 1. bar ## Code Inline `code` Block code ``` Sample text here... ``` Syntax highlighting ```js var foo = function (bar) { return bar++; }; console.log(foo(5)); ``` Syntax highlighting with file name, highlight line ```ts:cores.ts {2} export const cn = (classNames: ...any) => { return classNames.filter(Boolean).join(' '); } ``` ## Tables | Option | Description | | ------ | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | data | path to data files to supply the data that will be passed into templates. | | engine | engine to be used for processing templates. Handlebars is the default. | | ext | extension to be used for dest files. | Right aligned columns | Option | Description | | -----: | ------------------------------------------------------------------------: | | data | path to data files to supply the data that will be passed into templates. | | engine | engine to be used for processing templates. Handlebars is the default. | | ext | extension to be used for dest files. | ## Links [link text](https://nang01t2.github.io/) [**bold link text**](https://nang01t2.github.io/) [`code link text`](https://nang01t2.github.io/) Autoconverted link https://github.com/Nang01T2 ## Images ![Minion](https://octodex.github.com/images/minion.png) HTML `` tag

export default function remarkAdmonition() {\r
  return (tree) => {\r
    visit(tree, (node) => {\r
      if (\r
        node.type === "textDirective" ||\r
        node.type === "leafDirective" ||\r
        node.type === "containerDirective"\r
      ) {\r
        if (!["info", "warn", "danger"].includes(node.name)) return;\r
        // Store node.name before overwritten with "Alert".\r
        const status = node.name;\r
\r
        const data = node.data || (node.data = {});\r
        const tagName = node.type === "textDirective" ? "span" : "div";\r
\r
        node.type = "mdxJsxFlowElement";\r
        node.name = "Admonition";\r
        node.attributes = [\r
          { type: "mdxJsxAttribute", name: "status", value: status },\r
        ];\r
      }\r
    });\r
  };\r
}

import clsx from "clsx";\r
import React from "react";\r
\r
import styles from "./styles.module.scss";\r
\r
type SvgComponent = React.ComponentType<React.ComponentProps<"svg">>;\r
type Status = "info" | "danger" | "warn";\r
\r
type Props = {\r
  status?: Status;\r
  title?: React.ReactNode;\r
  children?: React.ReactNode;\r
  className?: string;\r
};\r
\r
const statusIconMap: { [S in Status]: SvgComponent } = {\r
  info: HiInformationCircle,\r
  danger: HiExclamationTriangle,\r
  warn: HiExclamationTriangle,\r
};\r
\r
export default function Message({\r
  status = "info",\r
  children,\r
  className,\r
}: Props) {\r
  const Icon = statusIconMap[status];\r
  const statusClass = styles[\`--\${status}\`];\r
  return (\r
    <aside className={clsx(styles.container, statusClass, className)}>\r
      <div>\r
        <Icon className={clsx(styles.icon, statusClass)} />\r
      </div>\r
      <div className={styles.text}>\r
        {children && <div className={styles.message}>{children}</div>}\r
      </div>\r
    </aside>\r
  );\r
}

$dangerColor: #e53e3e;\r
\r
.container {\r
  display: grid;\r
  grid-template-columns: auto 1fr;\r
  gap: 0.5rem;\r
  padding: 1rem;\r
  border-radius: 0.5rem;\r
  border: 1px solid #e2e8f0;\r
  border-left-width: 4px;\r
  background: white;\r
\r
  &.--info {\r
    border-left-color: $infoColor;\r
  }\r
  &.--warn {\r
    border-left-color: $warnColor;\r
  }\r
  &.--danger {\r
    border-left-color: $dangerColor;\r
  }\r
}\r
\r
.text {\r
  display: grid;\r
  row-gap: 0.25rem;\r
}\r
\r
.title {\r
  display: flex;\r
  align-items: center;\r
  column-gap: 0.5rem;\r
  font-weight: var(--camome-font-weight-bold);\r
  font-size: var(--camome-font-size-lg);\r
\r
  &.--info {\r
    color: $infoColor;\r
  }\r
  &.--warn {\r
    color: $warnColor;\r
  }\r
  &.--danger {\r
    color: $dangerColor;\r
  }\r
}\r
\r
.message {\r
  & > *:first-child {\r
    margin-top: 0;\r
  }\r
\r

    margin-bottom: 0;\r
  }\r
}\r

.icon {\r
  width: 1.75rem;\r
  height: 1.75rem;\r

    color: $infoColor;\r
  }\r
  &.--warn {\r
    color: $warnColor;\r
  }\r
  &.--danger {\r
    color: $dangerColor;\r
  }\r
}

Ut enim ad minim veniam, quis nostrud exercitation ullamco laboris nisi ut aliquip ex ea commodo consequat. --- ## Emphasis **This is bold text** _This is italic text_ ~~Strikethrough~~ ## Blockquotes > Blockquotes can also be nested... > > > ...by using additional greater-than signs right next to each other... > > > > > ...or with spaces between arrows. ## Lists Unordered - Create a list by starting a line with `-` or `*` - Sub-lists are made by indenting 2 spaces: - Marker character change forces new list start: - Ac tristique libero volutpat at * Facilisis in pretium nisl aliquet - Very easy! Ordered 1. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet 2. Consectetur adipiscing elit 3. Integer molestie lorem at massa 4. You can use sequential numbers... 5. ...or keep all the numbers as `1.` Start numbering with offset: 57. foo 1. bar ## Code Inline `code` Block code ``` Sample text here... ``` Syntax highlighting ```js var foo = function (bar) { return bar++; }; console.log(foo(5)); ``` Syntax highlighting with file name, highlight line ```ts:cores.ts {2} export const cn = (classNames: ...any) => { return classNames.filter(Boolean).join(' '); } ``` ## Tables | Option | Description | | ------ | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | data | path to data files to supply the data that will be passed into templates. | | engine | engine to be used for processing templates. Handlebars is the default. | | ext | extension to be used for dest files. | Right aligned columns | Option | Description | | -----: | ------------------------------------------------------------------------: | | data | path to data files to supply the data that will be passed into templates. | | engine | engine to be used for processing templates.
